docs.lead_paragraph: Our recent posts on President Obama's compromise with the Republicans on the Bush-era tax cuts generated scores of comments ranging from angry to disappointed to resigned. Below are some highlights:

headline.main: Reader Comments: The Obama Tax Deal

docs.lead_paragraph: Kenneth T. Cuccinelli II, Virginia's attorney general, is quick to cite the legal basis for challenging President Obama's signature legislative achievement: Congress has no power to punish people who choose not to buy private health insurance, he says.

headline.main: The Man Who Took On Obama Health Care — and Won One Round

docs.abstract: Ken Cuccinelli, Virginia's attorney general, challenged President Obama's signature legislative achievement in court, and on Monday, a judge ruled in his favor.
docs.snippet: Ken Cuccinelli, Virginia's attorney general, challenged President Obama's signature legislative achievement in court, and on Monday, a judge ruled in his favor.

docs.lead_paragraph: WHO ruled that a key provision in the Obama health care law is unconstitutional? WHO filed the case?

headline.main: A Ruling on the Health Care Law

docs.abstract: 6 Q's About the News | What is the Commerce Clause of the Constitution, and how did a federal judge apply it to the Obama health care law?
docs.snippet: 6 Q's About the News | What is the Commerce Clause of the Constitution, and how did a federal judge apply it to the Obama health care law?

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge declared a provision of the health care law unconstitutional. Yet there is still hope for reform because his decision limits the scope of the ruling.

docs.lead_paragraph: A provision requiring most Americans to obtain health insurance starting in 2014, which has survived two prior court challenges, was found unconstitutional.

headline.main: Judge Voids Key Element of Obama Health Care Law
headline.sub: Insurance Mandate Found to Exceed Congress’s Authority
headline.print_headline: CORE OF HEALTH CARE LAW IS REJECTED BY A U.S. JUDGE
